due.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: expected to happen or arrive at a particular time
due.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: The final results of the experiment are due on December 9.
I’m due at his office at 4.30.
The team are due to fly to Italy next month.
His new book is due to be published next year.
She’s pregnant and the baby’s due in April.
The car is due for its annual service again.
When are the library books due back?
due.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: owed to someone either as a debt or because they have a right to it
due.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Any money due you will be sent by cheque through the post.
Thanks are due to all those who took part.
due.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: if an amount of money is due, it must be paid at a particular time
due.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: The next income tax payment is due on 31 January.
due.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: He was banned for six months for driving without due care and attention.
We want the best for each individual child with due regard for the interests of the other children.
due.translation[3].definitions[0].defini: if an amount of money is due, it must be paid now or at the stated time
due.translation[3].definitions[0].exampl: Breakwater said it was unable to meet an interest payment due yesterday.
due.translation[3].definitions[1].exampl: He was charged with driving without due care and attention.
